trans-unit.source: The exception that occurs when an error condition prevents accessing or creating a <xref href="System.Printing.PrintSystemObject"></xref>.
> [!CAUTION] > Classes within the <xref:System.Printing> namespace are not supported for use within a Windows service or ASP.NET application or service.
Attempting to use these classes from within one of these application types may produce unexpected problems, such as diminished service performance and run-time exceptions.
If you want to print from a Windows Forms application, see the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing> namespace.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintSystemException"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintSystemException"></xref> class that provides a specific error message.
A string that describes the error condition.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintSystemException"></xref> class that provides a specific error code and error message.
An <xref:System.Int32> that is interpreted as an HRESULT, a coded numerical value that is assigned to a specific exception.
A string that describes the error condition.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintSystemException"></xref> class that provides specific serialization information and streaming context.
The data that is required to serialize or deserialize an object.
The context, including source and destination, of the serialized stream.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintSystemException"></xref> class that provides a specific error message, including the underlying cause of the exception.
A string that describes the error condition.
The underlying error condition that caused the exception.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintSystemException"></xref> class that provides a specific error code and error message, including the underlying cause of the exception.
An <xref:System.Int32> that is interpreted as an HRESULT, a coded numerical value that is assigned to a specific exception.
A string that describes the error condition.
The underlying error condition that caused the exception.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintSystemException"></xref> class that provides a specific error code, error message, and printer message.
An <xref:System.Int32> that is interpreted as an HRESULT, a coded numerical value that is assigned to a specific exception.
A string that describes the error condition.
The exception message sent by the printer driver or unmanaged print system component that caused the exception.
Gets the data that is used to serialize the object and gets the context of the serialized stream.
The data that is required to serialize or deserialize an object.
The context, including source and destination, of the serialized stream.
